Package pmsPackage

Class PersonalManagementSystem

java.lang.Object
pmsPackage.PersonalManagementSystem
public class PersonalManagementSystem
extends java.lang.Object

PersonalManagementSystem

This class implements the driver for the Personal Management System application. All menu logic is done in this class.

Created on 31 August 2020

Author:
Christian Harris

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private PersonalManagementSystem()
    Constructs a PersonalManagementSystem with an admin user and some data entries for testing.

  • Field Details

    • users

      private java.util.ArrayList<User> users

    • currentUser

      private User currentUser

    • in

      private java.util.Scanner in

    • userLoggedIn

      private boolean userLoggedIn

    • calendarViewer

      private boolean calendarViewer

  • Constructor Details

    • PersonalManagementSystem

      private PersonalManagementSystem()
      Constructs a PersonalManagementSystem with an admin user and some data entries for testing.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method begins the application by instantiating a new PersonalManagementSystem object and then calls the run method.
      Parameters:
      args - - a string array from the console.

    • run

      private void run()
      This method begins the application fully by clearing the console screen and calling the mainMenu method.

    • mainMenu

      private void mainMenu()
      The main menu of the application. Here users an login, make or delete users, or logout.

    • login

      private void login()
      This method controls the logic for an already existing user to login. Their username and passwords are checked for validity.

    • usernameExists

      private boolean usernameExists​(java.lang.String usr)
      This method returns true if there is a User in users with a username of usr.
      Parameters:
      usr - - the username of a User in users.
      Returns:
      - true if usr is a valid user.

    • setCurrentUser

      private void setCurrentUser​(java.lang.String usr)
      This method sets the current User of the applicaton to the user with username usr.
      Parameters:
      usr - - the user to be set as the current user.

    • checkPassword

      private boolean checkPassword​(java.lang.String usr, java.lang.String pswd)
      This method makes sure that the user usr has a password of pswd.
      Parameters:
      usr - - the username of a user.
      pswd - - the password of a user.
      Returns:
      - true if the username and password match, false otherwise.

    • createNewUser

      private void createNewUser()
      This method controls the logic for creating new users. Users must enter a username and password. Usernames cannot be the same as any username of previously created users. Both usernames and password must begin with letters.

    • deleteUser

      private void deleteUser()
      This method controls the logic for deleting a user. A username must be entered and then the correct password in order to successfully delete a user.

    • calendarView

      private void calendarView()
      This method control the logic for the calendar view of the application. The current users planner is called to display the current month. The user can then add/remove events, view all the current months events, view all events, switch to viewing thier lists, move to next/previous months, or logout.

    • viewCurrentMonthEvents

      private void viewCurrentMonthEvents​(java.time.LocalDate monthToView)
      This method handles the menu for interacting with all the events of the current month determined by the LocalDate monthToView.
      Parameters:
      monthToView - - the LocalDate object describing which month to interact with.

    • addEvent

      public void addEvent()
      This method handles all the logic for creating a new event. Fields marked with an * are required for successfully creating a new Event. Nothing is comitted to the current users planner until the user attempts to submit the data. If there are missing required fiels the user will be notified an no new Event will be created.

    • removeEvent

      private void removeEvent()
      This method handles the logic for removing an event based on its name. If no event with the given name exists the user is notified.

    • viewAllEvents

      private void viewAllEvents()
      This method handles the menu for viewing all Events which have been created by the current user.

    • viewEvent

      private void viewEvent​(java.lang.String eventName)
      This method views all the details for an Event with eventName.
      Parameters:
      eventName - - the name of an Event.

    • listsView

      private void listsView()
      This method handles the menu for viewing all the Lists the current user has created. Users can switch to the calendar view, add/remove lists, view the details of a list, or logout.

    • accessList

      private void accessList​(java.lang.String name)
      This method handles the logic for accessing the details of a specific list. Users can add/delete items, check/uncheck items, or return to a previous menu.
      Parameters:
      name - - the name of a List.

    • listExists

      private boolean listExists​(java.lang.String name)
      This method returns true if there exists a list with Name in the current users planner.
      Parameters:
      name - - the name of a List.
      Returns:
      - true if a List with name exists.

    • addList

      private void addList()
      This method handles the logic for creating a new list for the user.

    • deleteList

      private void deleteList()
      This method handles the logic for deleting a list made by the user.

    • clearConsole

      private void clearConsole()
      This is a method for clearing the console. It prints 50 emtpy lines. Should clear most consoles.

    • logout

      private void logout()
      This method logs out the current user. The userLoggedIn flag is set to false and the currentUser is set to point to null.
